snippet: Mitt Romney on Thursday branded President Obama a "crony capitalist" for making three appointments to the National Labor Relations Board without Congressional approval, suggesting the move was payback to organized labor for its political support.
abstract: Mitt Romney on Thursday branded President Obama a "crony capitalist" for making three appointments to the National Labor Relations Board without Congressional approval, suggesting the move was payback to organized labor for its political support.
lead_paragraph: SALEM, N.H. -- Mitt Romney on Thursday branded President Obama a "crony capitalist" for making three appointments to the National Labor Relations Board without Congressional approval, suggesting the move was a reward to organized labor for its political support.
